conclusion: Analyze step-by-step to find temperature at state C
State A: p = 3×10⁵ Pa, V = 1×10⁻³ m³; State B: p = 1×10⁵ Pa, V = 1×10⁻³ m³; State C: p = 1×10⁵ Pa, V = 3×10⁻³ m³
A to B: isovolume process; B to C: isobaric process
For same gas sample, n and R are constant; use P₁V₁/T₁ = P₂V₂/T₂
Calculate nR at state A: nR = P₁V₁/T₁ = 1 J/K
Calculate temperature at state C: T₃ = P₃V₃/(nR) = 300 K
Convert temperature at state C to Celsius: T₃ = 27°C
Rearrange and solve for T₃: T₃ = 300 K = 27°C
Final answer: Temperature at state C is 27°C
Equal PV products at states A and C indicate equal temperatures
